Key Match Events: Evan Mobley scored 34 points and 10 rebounds to fuel the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 134-122 victory over the Dallas Mavericks
Cleveland shot a robust 53.1 percent from the floor and 37.5 percent from 3-point range in the game
Dallas trimmed the deficit to nine at 129-120 with 1:16 to play before running out of gas
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played without former Cavalier Kyrie Irving (illness) and superstar Luka Doncic (calf) for the Dallas Mavericks
Others: Caris LeVert scored 17 points off the bench for the Cavaliers
Donovan Mitchell and Georges Niang each scored 15 points for Cleveland
Quentin Grimes scored 26 points, Jaden Hardy had 17 off the bench and Klay Thompson sank four of 10 3-point attempts to highlight his 16-point performance for the Mavericks
Brandon Williams made a short jumper to stake the Mavericks to a 21-17 lead before the Cavaliers responded by scoring the next 20 points to bridge the first and second quarters
Cleveland extended its lead to 18 points (41-23) on Dean Wade’s dunk in transition early in the second
Cleveland extended its lead to 78-53 early in the third quarter on a Mobley 3-pointer
Garland’s 3-pointer later in the quarter extended Cleveland’s advantage to 27 points at 93-66
